title: Development Process of e-Learning Teaching Methods in Higher Education Based on the ICARE Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of secondary education curricula and proficiency in digital device utilization
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment focused on social studies content development. Learners engage in integrated online-offline activities using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners design e-learning instructional materials using the 5-stage ICARE model (Introduction-Connection-Application-Reflection-Expansion).
Learners execute a quality control process applying expert validation (media, instructional design, content) and learner evaluation in digital content development.

Learners can select three real-life problems linked to social studies subjects (e.g., community issues, civic engagement) in a blended environment and design an e-learning activity plan combining online discussions (2 sessions) + offline workshops (1 session) for each problem, achieving a score of 4/5 or higher based on a rubric (clarity, feasibility, effectiveness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
